item.title: Wtf jadex?l0l
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:23, topic:414516”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=516484.msg3750712#msg3750712 date=1316017622]

[Bots] they go mine, woodcut, etc.
Than they stock it all up, and launch their own website with their friends or whatever, maybe it’s more professionally done than that…

Im thinking fagex made a deal with the bots, honestly?
What server ESPECIALLY a well coded one like R.S would sit there and let all the bots flourish?

How would you develop methods of getting rid of them?
[/quote]

Hmmm getting rid of bots…
I honestly don’t know their system or how it works, they most likely found a whole in a pinch of source code somewhere, i know bots work by checking for screen colors, so im guessing why not change their object colors?
Or maybe try adding a new system of human verification?
Simple process upon login that only a human could perform?
I mean yeah it could be a long and dumb-ass process but hey, if Jagex wants all those bots removed.
Their smart enough to come from box style graphics to what their at now?
They can remove the bots but they wont, because THEY are in on it.[/quote]

Most bots use hooking methods that involve grabbing client state information from the client as it runs, then faking input events in order to emulate some sort of action. And as for going from software to hardware, that wasn’t a stroke of brilliance, it was moreover them waking up and realizing they were a decade behind the second RS2 was released. They are still way behind in the graphics world (maybe not so much in relation to other RPGs, but definitely not a forerunner).

As for more humanistic checks, what exactly do you have in mind? Captchas? I’m pretty sure Jagex tried that in RSC, much to the dissension of the RS community. Chances are, most of the solutions you could come up with add an inconvenience to the game. This is part of security theory: trade inconvenience for security. Jagex doesn’t want to inconvenience their players (hence the removal of random events), because that’s even worse for business. This is why they focus on alleged systems in their servers which can analyze client behavior and likely use some sort of point or degree system indicating the chances of it being automated or humanistic. These systems are probably very complicated, and for those reasons, are very difficult to be absolutely correct. If they aren’t reliable, then they can’t use them most of the time (for fear of banning legitimate players).

What’s the result of all this? What we have now. It’s not that they aren’t trying, it’s that it is a very difficult battle to fight.

IlikeArrays:

Oh bs… like usual. Jagex has some of top developers in the world but yet they can’t stop some teenagers from making bots? Obvious bs is obvious.

You’re rather naive to think Jagex has some of the top developers in the world. Companies like IBM, GE, and Microsoft have teams of people to manage teams of programmers, where the managers number greater than Jagex’s whole company, including their customer service. And, despite me disliking Microsoft, it’s a fantastic place to work and they really do only hire the best. Same can probably be said for Google, GE, IBM, and many other corporate entities.

Read full topic
